posts.cooked: Do they skip the 2026 firmware? An image was captured in Phoenix Tuner X with simulated code.

posts.name: Brian Wagg
posts.cooked: This is likely to support teams alpha testing the new SystemCore controller, scheduled to roll out to all teams in 2027. The 2026 firmware will likely come out much closer to kickoff this year as CTRE develops new features for this coming season.

link_counts.title: [FRC BLOG] SystemCore Alpha Testing - First Wave

posts.name: Scott W
posts.cooked: I believe this is to be compatible with the new control system, which is currently being tested by some beta tester teams, but isn’t due for general release until 2027.

posts.name: Dalton
posts.cooked: This firmware is designed to support the 2027 SystemCore alpha and will only work with this specific version. It is not compatible with the 2025 API or WPILib versions or any earlier channel firmware.

suggested_topics.excerpt: How is your team utilizing PhotoVision to align to the posts? Do you call the pose offset from the tag and use Path planner? Or use PID controllers to move your drivetrain to it? Or something else?

accepted_answer.excerpt:
This firmware is indeed to support the 2027 SystemCore alpha, intended for usage with SystemCore. 
This firmware is not compatible with the 2025 of API or WPILib. 2025 or previous channel firmware is not compatible with the 2027 SystemCore alpha. 
I apologize for the confusion here.
